definition: to fawn on/to ingratiate oneself/(literary) to meet face to face
to meet by chance/to come across/(of a calendar event) to come along/(of an event) to fall on (a particular day)/to fawn upon
to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself

sentences.english: The candidates all pandered to Michigan's biggest special interest.
sentences.chinese: 所有的競選者都圍繞密西根最大的利益焦點極力逢迎。

sentences.english: Tynan bent too much to current hip opinion, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲泰南太過於逢迎當前時髦的意見。

sentences.english: Millet made a portrait of Lady Chesterfield, which flattered her.
sentences.chinese: 米勒爲了逢迎柴斯特菲爾德夫人而替她畫了一幅像。

sentences.english: Ingratiation is that you show you unction which would make other people feel uncomfortable and have defensive feeling.
sentences.chinese: 逢迎是虛情假意，那會造成別人的戒心和不舒服。

sentences.english: Greenspan will leave an economy in shambles and a lifetime of pandering.
sentences.chinese: 格林斯潘留下了一團糟的經濟和一生的逢迎討好。

sentences.english: Though his tone was respectful, sometimes obsequious , he was also canny.
sentences.chinese: 儘管語氣中頗有敬意，有時候甚至逢迎，但他很謹慎。

definition: to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to flatter/to toady
to fawn on/to flatter/to ingratiate oneself/flattery
(honorific) to greet/to fawn
flattering and fawning (idiom)/sweet-talking
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to ingratiate oneself with/to pander to
against one's will/willy-nilly
to fawn on/to kiss up to
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to resort to bragging and flattering
servile and bending the knee (idiom); fawning/bending and scraping to curry favor
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to flatter/to fawn on/to butter sb up/toadying/bootlicking
